bytecode

Class BranchingBytecode

  • java.lang.Object
    • bytecode.Bytecode
      • bytecode.BranchingBytecode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NonCallingBytecode
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BranchingComparisonBytecode, BranchingConstantComparisonBytecode

    public abstract class BranchingBytecode
extends Bytecode
implements NonCallingBytecode
    A bytecode with two subsequent bytecodes. It checks a condition and consequently routes the computation at the end of a branching block of code.
    Author:
    Fausto Spoto

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.apache.bcel.generic.InstructionList generateJavaBytecode(JavaClassGenerator classGen, org.apache.bcel.generic.InstructionHandle yes, org.apache.bcel.generic.InstructionHandle no)
      Generates the Java bytecode that checks the condition expressed by this bytecode and goes to one of two possible targets depending on the outcome of that check.
      abstract BranchingBytecode negate()
      Yields a branching bytecode that expresses the opposite condition of this.

      • generateJavaBytecode

        public final org.apache.bcel.generic.InstructionList generateJavaBytecode(JavaClassGenerator classGen,
                                                                          org.apache.bcel.generic.InstructionHandle yes,
                                                                          org.apache.bcel.generic.InstructionHandle no)
        Generates the Java bytecode that checks the condition expressed by this bytecode and goes to one of two possible targets depending on the outcome of that check. Namely, it generates the code

        generateJavaBytecodeAux(...yes)
        goto no
        Parameters:
        classGen - the Java class generator to be used for this code generation
        yes - the target if the check is satisfied
        no - the target if the check in not satisfied
        Returns:
        the Java bytecode that checks the condition expressed by this bytecode and goes to yes or no depending on the outcome of that check
